did.unittitle: Vocabularies of the Okonagan, Attnaha, and Walla Walla languages, [and] Vocabularies of the languages of Indians inhabiting N.W. America, 1834-1836
did.abstract: These vocabularies were obtained from Indians, people of mixed ancestry, and traders, with most of the informants identified. One volume appears to contain the notes from which the other was prepared.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vocabularies of the Okonagan, Attnaha, and Walla Walla languages (497.3 T66). Vocabularies arranged in parallel columns of the same languages as in "Indians inhabiting N.W. America" below, excepting the Cree, Kalapooyah, Klikatat, and Seauteux. Probably the original document from which the copy volume below was made.

Vocabularies of the languages of Indians inhabiting N.W. America (497.3 T66.1). Vocabularies collected by Townsend during tour, sponsored in part by the APS and the Academy of Natural Sciences, of the Sandwich Islands and the Northwest. Obtained by dictation from natives, people of mixed ancestry, and traders of the Hudson's Bay Company.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John Kirk Townsend was a naturalist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by John Kirk Townsend, 1838, and Peter S. Du Ponceau, 1844. See in-house shelf list for additional accession numbers.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This dictionary, compiled during John Kirk Townsendâ€™s travels between 1834 and 1836, contains English translations for some words in Okonagan, Attnaha, and Walla Walla languages.

did.unittitle: Vocabularies of the Okonagan, Attnaha, and Walla Walla languages, [and] Vocabularies of the languages of Indians inhabiting N.W. America, 1834-1836.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This appears to be the original of a more complete and perfect copy (497.3:T66).
